Articles.Content:
So I've been avoiding information about planets and moons as much as I can so that I can find it out myself. I just finished a major excursion to Jool bringing 8 landing probes and 8 space probes, and the landing probes were useless. My main ship didn't have the fuel to visit every moon, and the ground probes didn't have enough fuel to both get to the moon and slow the landing.

So here's my new idea, a combination of the two. The space probe already weighed 1.21 and together it weighs 1.56, so shouldn't affect it too much.

I'd love to see other people's probes. Focusing more on usefulness than how it looks, but if it's both that's good too. It would be especially nice to see some good landing probes for atmospheric conditions.

Bonus picture of the probe transport:

All credit for the original buggy (99% of this) goes to Mulbin: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/26781-0-19-Duna-LK1-%28yes-Duna%21%29-Soyuz-inspired-Duna-return-CM-Lander-and-micro-buggy%21

It can actually be ridden with use of the ladders on the back (placed in such a way that you don't slide off). I'm going to see if I can use this one for planets with atmosphere.

The buggy

Boxed

X-ray vision
Nobody makes probes? I know I never really see probe designs in this forum but I didn't think it was this bad.

This are some of my probes:

A Ion powered gilly lander:

A rover landing on Eve using a skycrane:

A voyager style probe, it made a Jool flyby and get into a escape trayectory by adding about 180 m/s at Jool's periapsis. The transfer stage aerobraked and was place in orbit around Tylo:

And this is a ship carrying 2 Pol landing probes, 2 Bop landing probes, a Laythe landing probe and a Jool impactor in that central section:
So do you have different designs for each individual planet/moon? I was hoping to be able to only have the 3 probes, one lander for atmosphere, one lander for non-atmosphere and a space probe.

I have designed 3 standard tranfer stages and 2 skycranes (one for atmosphere and one non-atmosphere). Also, I use the same space probe and the same rover but my landing probes are designed for specific tasks.
